snippet: Officials said changes to the H-2B program would add protections for foreign temporary workers and also spur recruitment of Americans.
abstract: Labor Department unveils rules that reshape a program for foreign migrants in work other than agriculture in effort to strengthen protections for those workers and also spur recruitment of Americans for such jobs; move is latest in a protracted battle between employers and the Obama administration over nation's temporary guest workers.
lead_paragraph: Officials said changes to the H-2B program would add protections for foreign temporary workers and also spur recruitment of Americans.

headline.seo: Rules Revised for H-2B Guest Worker Program
headline.main: Labor Dept. Issues New Rules for Guest Workers
headline.print_headline: New Rules for Guest Workers Are Issued by the Labor Dept.
